attributes.comment:
I find it disheartening that there are proposed fee increases in the costs relating to
adoption. Adoption is a process that requires a huge emotional investment as well
as financial. While the proposal appears to be a minor increase please keep in
mind that total adoption costs can exceed $30,000. Not only that but many
families may have to pay these fees TWICE depending on referral wait time for the
countries that they are working with because of expiration dates. Which is also
ridiculous considering fingerprinting. Why would our fingerprints expire? They don't
change.

As a parent and a former prospective adoptive parent, I would never support fee
increases for adoption costs whether implemented by the governments involved or
the agencies involved. In fact, it should be much easier.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Olivia J. Pitts
